prompt: <description>Part 1: A rectangular prism with a tapered top and bottom, and a cylindrical hole through its center Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will serve as the base for our first CAD part. Sketch Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 1. Draw the first line, starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Draw the second line, starting at [0.75, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.0469]. 3. Draw the third line, starting at [0.75, 0.0469] and ending at [0.0, 0.0469]. 4. Draw the fourth line, starting at [0.0, 0.0469] and ending at [0.0, 0.0]. Extrusion Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.1406 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Apply sketch scaling of 0.75. The result is a 3D prism with a tapered top and bottom and a height of 0.1406. Part 2: A series of rectangular prisms aligned in a straight line Create a new coordinate system based on the previous part, but with a translation vector of [0.0938, 0.0, 0.1406]. Sketch Draw multiple sketches on different planes of the coordinate system: 1. Sketch 1: Create a rectangle similar to Part 1's sketch using line_1, line_2, line_3, and line_4. 2. Sketch 2: Create a smaller rectangle by shifting the start point of each line from Sketch 1. 3. Sketch 3: Create another rectangle, smaller than the previous one by further shifting the start points of each line. 4. Sketch 4: Create a final rectangle, even smaller than the previous one, similarly shifting the start points. Extrusion Extrude each sketch equally in the positive Z direction by 0.0469, creating a series of rectangular prisms. Apply sketch scaling of 0.6562. The result is a line of rectangular prisms with varying heights and widths. Final Shape Combine Part 1 and Part 2 following these guidelines: 1. For Part 1, identify any area where it intersects with Part 2. If necessary, cut or trim materials based on the intersection, ensuring a clean fit between both parts. 2. For Part 2, introduce an additional sketch on a new plane within the coordinate system of Part 1. This new sketch should feature a cylindrical shape with specified dimensions. 3. Extrude the cylindrical sketch on Part 2's existing Z-depth with a cut operation, effectively creating a cylindrical hole through the center of the rectangular prism (Part 1). The scale should remain the same as Part 2's initial extrusion. The resulting shape will be the desired rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole through its center.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0469]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0469],"End Point":[0.0,0.0469]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0469],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.1406,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0938,0.0,0.1406]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.0938,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.0938,0.0],"End Point":[0.0938,0.0469]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.0938,0.0469],"End Point":[0.0,0.0469]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0469],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}},"face_2":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.1875,0.0],"End Point":[0.2812,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.2812,0.0],"End Point":[0.2812,0.0469]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.2812,0.0469],"End Point":[0.1875,0.0469]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.1875,0.0469],"End Point":[0.1875,0.0]}}},"face_3":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.0],"End Point":[0.4688,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.4688,0.0],"End Point":[0.4688,0.0469]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.4688,0.0469],"End Point":[0.375,0.0469]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.0469],"End Point":[0.375,0.0]}}},"face_4":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.5625,0.0],"End Point":[0.6562,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.6562,0.0],"End Point":[0.6562,0.0469]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.6562,0.0469],"End Point":[0.5625,0.0469]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.5625,0.0469],"End Point":[0.5625,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0469,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.6562,"operation":"JoinFeatureOperation"}}}}

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.4506, 0.0] Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Begin by drawing the following lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5201] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5201], End Point [0.6077, 0.5201] - Line 4: Start Point [0.6077, 0.5201], End Point [0.6077, 0.1916] - Line 5: Start Point [0.6077, 0.1916], End Point [0.1423, 0.1916] - Line 6: Start Point [0.1423, 0.1916], End Point [0.1423, 0.5201] - Line 7: Start Point [0.1423, 0.5201], End Point [0.0, 0.5201] - Line 8: Start Point [0.0, 0.5201], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal vector by a distance of 0.4506 to create part 1. **Part 2: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** Create a new coordinate system for part 2 with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.6077, 0.1395, 0.5201] Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Begin by drawing the following lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.1423, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.1423, 0.0], End Point [0.1423, 0.1848] - Line 3: Start Point [0.1423, 0.1848], End Point [0.0, 0.1848] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.1848], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1848. Extrude the 3D sketch along the opposite normal vector by a distance of 0.1258 to cut part 2 from the solid. The final shape will be a 3D model of a rectangular prism with various shapes and sizes cut out of it.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side.** **1.1 Create the coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **1.2 Sketch the first face** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. ** loops and curves in face\\_1 ** For face\\_1, there are 4 arcs (arc\\_1, arc\\_2, arc\\_3, arc\\_4) and 4 lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4) forming a single loop. * arc\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0433], Mid Point [0.0127, 0.0127], End Point [0.0433, 0.0] * line\\_1: Start Point [0.0433, 0.0], End Point [0.7067, 0.0] * arc\\_2: Start Point [0.7067, 0.0], Mid Point [0.7373, 0.0127], End Point [0.75, 0.0433] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0433], End Point [0.75, 0.0961] * arc\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.0961], Mid Point [0.7373, 0.1267], End Point [0.7067, 0.1393] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.7067, 0.1393], End Point [0.0433, 0.1393] * arc\\_4: Start Point [0.0433, 0.1393], Mid Point [0.0127, 0.1267], End Point [0.0, 0.0961] * line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0961], End Point [0.0, 0.0433] This loop defines the top face of the prism with a curved side. **1.3 Sketch the second face** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system, and select the mirror tool using the X-axis as the mirror line. This will create the bottom face of the prism mirrored along the X-axis, with the same dimensions as the first face (face\\_1). **1.4 Create a parametric 3D model by extruding the sketch** * Scaling: 0.75 * Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.0245 * Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 * Operation: New solid body This will create the rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. **1.5 Summary** The part is completed. The rectangular prism has the following measurements: * Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. * Length: 0.75 m * Width: 0.75 m * Height: 0.0245 m (including the height of the curved side)</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a stylized pyramid. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Draw the following 2D sketch for face 1 of part 1 using the given coordinate system: * Sketch a line (line\\_1) between points (0.0, 0.0) and (0.5, 0.0). * Sketch a line (line\\_2) between points (0.5, 0.0) and (0.5, 0.1244). * Sketch a line (line\\_3) between points (0.5, 0.1244) and (0.75, 0.1244). * Sketch a line (line\\_4) between points (0.75, 0.1244) and (0.75, 0.375). * Sketch a line (line\\_5) between points (0.75, 0.375) and (0.0, 0.375). * Sketch a line (line\\_6) between points (0.0, 0.375) and (0.0, 0.0). This composite sketch consists of 6 linear paths (lines) forming a closed profile on a single face. Scale the 2D sketch with a sketch scale factor of 0.75. Transform and rotate the 2D sketch into 3D using the following euler angles and translation vector: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Extrude the 2D profile into 3D along the normal vector with an extrude depth towards the normal of 0.25, and opposite normal depth of 0.0. Then, apply the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" to construct the final shape for part 1. Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. Create a new coordinate system for part 2: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.5, 0.0, 0.0] Draw the 2D sketch for face 1 in part 2. * Sketch a line (line\\_1) between points (0.0, 0.0) and (0.25, 0.0). * Sketch a line (line\\_2) between points (0.25, 0.0) and (0.25, 0.1244). * Sketch a line (line\\_3) between points (0.25, 0.1244) and (0.0, 0.1244). * Sketch a line (line\\_4) between points (0.0, 0.1244) and (0.0, 0.0). This composite sketch has 4 lines forming a closed rectangular profile in a single plane. Scale the 2D sketch with a sketch scale factor of 0.25. Transform and rotate the 2D sketch into 3D using the part 2 coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.5, 0.0, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch into 3D along the normal vector using the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.125 * Opposite normal depth: 0 Perform the "JoinFeatureOperation" to complete the part 2 assembly by adding its volume to the overall structure.</description>
